Subjective: Hard stools for months; Constipation, 2-3 days without bowel movement; Abdominal pain, cramping; Bloated feeling; Underweight, no recent weight loss; Painful passing of hard stools; Sister has colitis ulcerosa, but patient does not suspect this; Normal menses, urination; No blood in stool; No changes in eating habits. Request: Know if worrying, how to soften stools.
Objective: Abdomen: Tympanic sounds, tenderness in lower left; No fever.
Assessment: Suspected Irritable Bowel Syndrome, constipation-predominant. No signs of colitis ulcerosa or other alarming symptoms.
Plan: 1. Prescribe Psyllium fiber sachets, take daily with plenty of water for 6 weeks. 2. Evaluate after 6 weeks. 3. Safety net: Return earlier if increased abdominal pain, fever, or blood in stool. 4. Discuss referral to dietitian next visit.
